description: Change of use from Use Class C3 (dwelling house and outbuilding) to Use Class C4 (house in multiple occupation - HMO) with cycle and refuse storage.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the end of three years from the date of this permission. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Site Location Plan PP-13846220v1,Existing Ground Floor Plan BD-WC-547SN-25 RevA 02/02/2025Proposed Ground Floor BD-WC-547SN-30 RevA 02/02/2025Existing First Floor Plan E-FF  BD-WC-547SN-26 RevA 02/02/2025Existing First Floor Plan P-FF  BD-WC-547SN-26 RevA 02/02/2025Proposed Ground Floor 1:100 PGF  BD-WC-547SN-303 RevA 02/02/2025Existing Front Elevation BD-WC-547SN-28 RevA 02/02/2025Existing Rear Elevation BD-WC-547SN-27 RevA 02/02/2025Existing Side Elevation BD-WC-547SN-29 RevA 02/02/2025Proposed 3D View BD-WC-547SN-305 RevA 02/02/2025 Highway Safety Impact Form,Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied by more than five residents at any one time without first obtaining the approval, in writing, of the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure that the future occupation of the building does not adversely affect the adjoining premises/immediate occupiers.

No cooking facilities, including hot plates, shall be installed in the bedrooms of the development hereby permitted unless details have first been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Any cooking facilities shall thereafter only be implemented in accordance with the details that have been approved pursuant to this condition.Reason: To accord with the stipulations of definition as a House of Multiple Occupation and to safeguard the residential character of the surrounding area.

Within three months of the date of this permission, refuse storage facilities including facilities for the recycling of waste shall be installed in accordance with Enfield's Household Recycling and Waste Planning Guidance for New Developments (February 2024). The facilities shall be maintained thereafter.Reason: To ensure the suitable provision for the occupiers of the development, to encourage the sustainable management of waste and to safeguard the visual amenities of the area.

Within three months of the date of this permission, 5 long stay cycle parking spaces shall be provided in compliance with the following criteria:o in an accessible location: the access route to the store should be a minimum of 1.2m wide to enable the bike to enter the store, should be step free and involve no more than 2 doors or gate (excluding the store door).o secured: with a British Standard mortice lock or access fobo fully enclosed: 4 walls and a roofReason: To ensure that adequate cycle parking is available on site and to promote sustainable modes of transport (Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

Notwithstanding the details submitted as part of this application, no vehicular parking shall be permitted within the front boundary of the site until a detailed parking management plan to include details of parking layout, manoeuvring, visibility splays and pedestrian access has been submitted to an approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Thereafter the approved parking management plan shall be implemented and operated for the duration of the permitted use.Reason: To enable vehicles to draw off, park and turn clear of the highway, minimising danger, obstruction and inconvenience to users of the adjoining highway and to ensure that pedestrian and vehicular safety is not prejudiced (Policies D5, D6, D8, T6 and T6.1 of the London Plan (2021).

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: LHA Maximum Height Level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 150 metres in height (492.1 feet).
LLA Maximum height level: All buildings, structures, and works exceeding 300 metres in height (984.2 feet)
CILRES CIL ZONE: Lower Rate Eastern Zone - RATE: £40 per square metre
DMDAAP Designation: Area Action Plan- Area: Central Leaside- Policy: Core policy 37
